trial_identification.studytitle: Evaluation of a neuropathic ulcers prevention program for people with Diabetes
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Evaluation of a neuropathic ulcers prevention program for patients with Diabetes - a randomized controled trial, two years follow up

interventions.interventions: Therapeutic education and protective footwear. Education class was given by the examiner on 4 group sessions of one hour, once a week for a total of 4 weeks. Special games were used as a teaching tool. During the individual follow up examination (three-months intervals reevaluations), instruction for foot care were reinforced. The protective footwear was supplied according to individual prescriptions to be worn daily for, at least, 6 hours. Two pairs were supplied during the 2 years follow up.
interventions.comparator: Non sistematic therapeutic education: Brief and general patient instructions for the care of foot were provided during the individual follow up examinations (three-months intervals reevaluations).

primaryOutcome.outcome: neuropathic ulcers: number of incidence and relapses of ulceration (detected during foot examination and interview of the patient in the three-months intervals reevaluations)
primaryOutcome.timepoint: at the end of 2 years follow up

secondaryOutcome.outcome: survival time without any ulcers (no incidence and relapses of ulceration detected during foot examination and interview of the patient in the three-months intervals reevaluations)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: at the end of 2 years follow up (three-months intervals reevaluations)

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: People with diabetic insensitive foot in risk to ulceration
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Neuropathy from other causes, diabetic patients without medical assistance

trial_design.concealment: Recruitment at a general diabetes clinic, evaluation, random allocation between intervention or control group. The examiner was unaware when the decision of allocation was done. Allocation envolved an off-site person of the research team who used a randomized table created by a computer software.
trial_design.sequence: Simple randomisation by using a randomization table created by a computer software

ethicsAndSummary.summary: 53 patients from a public health center in Porto Alegre/RS, with diabetes and neuropathy, were enrolled in a clinical trial and followed up for two years. Subjects were randomly allocated in either intervention or control group. Therapeutic education was provided in group sessions, and a protective footwear supplied according to individual prescriptions. Statistical analysis using Mann-Whitney non-parametrical test was performed to determine differences in incidence and relapses of ulceration between groups. An analysis of life table and Kaplan-Meier method were used to measure survival time without any ulcers.
